autoInsurancePage.faqSubtitle: Answers to common questions about auto insurance in Georgia

faq.q: Is MTPL mandatory when entering Georgia?
faq.a: Yes, third-party liability insurance is mandatory for all foreign vehicles entering Georgia.

faq.q: Where can I get MTPL insurance?
faq.a: You can get the policy at the border or in advance online. We'll help you get insurance quickly without queues.
The insurance covers damage to third parties: up to 300,000 GEL for health damage and up to 50,000 GEL for property damage.

faq.q: For how long can I get insurance?
faq.a: Available periods: 15 days, 30 days, 90 days, or 1 year. Choose based on your trip duration.

faq.q: What happens if I don't get MTPL?
faq.a: Without a valid MTPL policy, you cannot enter Georgia by car. You will be turned away at the border.

visitor.description: DAILY INSURANCE - Enjoy peace of mind during your visit to Georgia. This insurance covers unexpected health-related expenses that can arise during your stay. Our expert team provides comprehensive insurance consultations, guaranteeing top-quality service. Buy health insurance online and receive your policy via email within minutes.

faq.question: Who is eligible to purchase this insurance?
faq.answer: The insurance is intended for foreign citizens and stateless tourists under the age of 70 staying in Georgia.

faq.question: What does the insurance cover?
faq.answer: The insurance covers emergency medical expenses and accidental death occurring during the individual insurance period.

faq.question: What is a deductible and how does it work?
faq.answer: A deductible is the amount deducted from the insurance reimbursement and paid by the insured person. The deductible is 100 GEL per case and applies to all services covered by the insurance card (except the 24/7 hotline, repatriation, and emergency medical assistance).

faq.question: What should you do in case of an insurance event?
faq.answer: You must immediately contact the appropriate medical provider and the 24/7 hotline 032 292 22 22. To receive the service please present your insurance policy.

faq.question: How to receive discounts on medical services?
faq.answer: To receive discounts, the insured person must contact the 24-hour call center, schedule a visit with a general practitioner, who will identify the issue and issue a discount voucher for the designated provider clinic specified by the insurer.

standard.description: EMERGENCY STANDARD insurance program for foreign citizens staying in Georgia for up to 3 months. Includes 24/7 support, emergency medical assistance, and hospitalization due to accidents.

faq.question: Who can be insured?
faq.answer: Only citizens of foreign countries aged 1 to 69 can be insured under this agreement.

faq.question: What territory does the insurance cover?
faq.answer: The insurance is valid in the territory of Georgia (except occupied territories).

faq.question: What is the waiting period?
faq.answer: The waiting period is counted from the start date of insurance, during which expenses will not be reimbursed.

faq.question: How to submit a reimbursement claim?
faq.answer: The deadline for submitting reimbursement documents is 15 days from payment of medical services. Reimbursement is made via non-cash payment.

faq.question: What is not covered by insurance?
faq.answer: Not covered: events before insurance start, treatment without call center notification, psychiatric illnesses, alternative medicine, prostheses and implants, alcohol/drug abuse consequences.

uno-active.description: MEDICAL STANDARD insurance for long-term stay in Georgia. Comprehensive coverage including family doctor services, emergency and planned hospital care, outpatient services and dental care.

coverage.title: Day hospital at partner clinics (12 mo. wait)

faq.question: Who can purchase MEDICAL STANDARD?
faq.answer: MEDICAL STANDARD is suitable for tourists, expats, and anyone planning a long-term stay in Georgia, aged 0 to 64 years.

faq.question: What is the waiting period?
faq.answer: For planned hospitalization and day hospital â€” 12 months. For emergency services â€” no waiting period.

faq.question: Is pregnancy covered?
faq.answer: Yes, pregnancy care is covered at 50% with 500 GEL limit at partner clinics by personal doctor referral.

faq.question: What dental services are included?
faq.answer: Emergency dental 100% (500 GEL), planned 30% (300 GEL), SGS implants 60% (1500 GEL), dental CT 40% (500 GEL).

faq.question: Is medication covered?
faq.answer: Yes, medications at GPC-Pharmadepot pharmacy network are covered at 50% with 800 GEL limit.

uno-active-plus.description: MEDICAL FLEXI enhanced medical insurance for long-term stay in Georgia. Extended coverage with higher limits for hospital care, expanded dental services and additional benefits.

coverage.title: Day hospital at partner clinics (12 mo. wait)

faq.question: What is the difference from MEDICAL STANDARD?
faq.answer: MEDICAL FLEXI has higher limits: hospital up to 10,000 GEL (vs 5,000), planned hospital 100%/8,000 GEL (vs 80%/4,000), outpatient up to 1,500 GEL.

faq.question: What is the waiting period?
faq.answer: For planned hospitalization and day hospital â€” 12 months. For emergency services â€” no waiting period.

faq.question: Is pregnancy covered?
faq.answer: Yes, pregnancy care is covered at 50% with 800 GEL limit at partner clinics by personal doctor referral.

faq.question: What dental services are included?
faq.answer: Emergency dental 100% unlimited, planned 60% (1500 GEL), SGS implants 60% (1500 GEL), dental CT 40% (500 GEL).

faq.question: Is medication covered?
faq.answer: Yes, medications at GPC-Pharmadepot pharmacy network are covered at 55% with 1500 GEL limit.

faq.label: FAQ
faq.title: Crystal
faq.description: Everything you need to know before getting your insurance policy

items.question: What documents are needed to get insurance?
items.answer: You only need your passport to get insurance. The whole process takes 10-15 minutes, and you receive your policy by email immediately after payment.

items.question: When does the insurance start?
items.answer: The insurance starts from the date specified in the policy. You can choose the start date when applying.

items.question: What does the insurance cover?
items.answer: The insurance covers emergency medical care, hospitalization, outpatient treatment, prescription medications, emergency dental care, and repatriation.

items.question: How do I use the insurance if needed?
items.answer: Call the 24/7 hotline listed in your policy. The operator will arrange medical care and coordinate everything with the clinic directly.

items.question: Can I extend my insurance?
items.answer: Yes, you can extend your insurance at any time before your current policy expires. Just contact us.

items.question: Are there age restrictions?
items.answer: Insurance is available for people aged 0 to 70. For those over 70, terms are discussed individually.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.description: Learn how we collect, use and protect your personal information when applying for insurance.

section1.title: 1. General Provisions
section1.p1: This Privacy Policy defines the procedure for processing and protecting personal data collected through the georgian.support website, which provides medical insurance services for tourists and expats in Georgia.
section1.p2: By using the Site, you confirm your agreement with the terms of this Policy.

section2.title: 2. What Data We Collect
section2.intro: We may collect the following categories of users' personal data:
items: Name and contact details (phone, email) provided in contact forms;
Information provided in messages when contacting through the Site or messengers;
Technical data: IP address, browser and device data, cookies, site page visit information;
Additional information that the user voluntarily provides when applying for insurance.

section3.title: 3. Purposes of Personal Data Processing
section3.intro: Personal data is processed exclusively for the following purposes:
items: Contacting the user and providing consultation on insurance products;
Preparation and processing of insurance policies;
Improving the quality of the Site and company services;
Compliance with Georgian legislation requirements;
Ensuring security and preventing abuse.
section3.noSpam: We do not use your data for advertising without your consent.

section4.title: 4. Data Transfer to Third Parties
section4.intro: We do not transfer your data to third parties, except in cases:
items: If required by Georgian legislation;
If necessary for processing the insurance policy (transfer of data to the partner insurance company);
If you have given direct consent to the data transfer.
section4.noSale: We do not sell or distribute your data for commercial purposes.

section5.title: 5. Data Storage and Protection
section5.p1: We apply technical and organizational measures to protect personal data from unauthorized access, modification or deletion.
section5.p2: Only authorized employees working within their official duties have access to the data.

section6.title: 6. Use of Cookies
section6.p1: The Site uses cookies for proper operation and analysis of user interaction with the Site.
section6.p2: You can disable cookies in your browser settings, but this may affect the functionality of the Site.

section7.title: 7. User Rights
items: Request information about your personal data;
Require their correction or update;
Request data deletion if it does not contradict legislation;
Withdraw consent to data processing.
section7.contact: To exercise your rights, you can contact us using the contacts provided below.

section8.title: 8. Links to Third-Party Resources
section8.text: The Site may contain links to third-party websites. We are not responsible for their privacy policies and content. We recommend reviewing the rules of these sites separately.

section9.title: 9. Policy Changes
section9.text: We reserve the right to update this Policy at any time. The updated version takes effect from the moment of its posting on the Site.

section10.title: 10. Contacts
section10.text: For questions related to privacy policy and personal data processing, please contact:

terms.title: Terms and Conditions
terms.description: Review the terms and conditions for medical insurance services.

section1.title: 1. General Provisions
section1.p1: These terms and conditions govern the use of the georgian.support website, which provides medical insurance services for tourists and expats in Georgia.
section1.p2: By using the Site, you confirm your agreement with these Terms. If you do not agree with them, please stop using the Site.

section2.title: 2. Purpose of the Site
section2.p1: The Site is intended to provide information about medical insurance services for tourists, expats, and residents of Georgia.
section2.p2: All information posted on the Site is for reference purposes and does not constitute a public offer or insurance contract. Specific insurance terms are determined by the partner insurance company.

section3.title: 3. Services
section3.p1: Actual insurance policy processing is carried out only after agreeing on details with a manager and confirming the application by the client.
section3.p2: We act as an intermediary between the client and the insurance company, helping to select the optimal insurance product and supporting the processing.

section4.title: 4. Liability
items: Use of information from the Site without consulting a specialist;
Possible technical failures or unavailability of the Site;
Actions of third parties affecting the operation of the Site;
Decisions of the insurance company on insurance claims;
Losses arising from the user's incorrect interpretation of information from the Site.
section4.note: The company reserves the right to change the content of the Site without prior notice.

section5.title: 5. Data Confidentiality
section5.p1: Personal data transmitted through contact forms or messengers is used only for communication with the user and processing of the insurance policy.
section5.p2: We do not transfer personal data to third parties, except for the partner insurance company and cases provided by Georgian legislation.

section6.title: 6. Intellectual Property
section6.p1: All text materials, logos, images, Site structure and design elements are the intellectual property of the company.
section6.p2: Any copying, distribution or reproduction of materials is prohibited without written permission from the company.

section7.title: 7. Prohibited Actions
items: Using the Site for purposes that violate Georgian legislation;
Placing malicious software or performing actions that disrupt the operation of the Site;
Copying Site materials without the consent of the copyright holder;
Providing knowingly false information when applying for insurance.

section8.title: 8. Amendments
section8.text: We reserve the right to update the Terms at any time. The updated version takes effect from the moment of publication on the Site.

section9.title: 9. Contacts
section9.text: For questions related to the terms and conditions of use of the site, please contact:
